Abstract: Next-generation ion mobility experiments are revolutionizing the field of mass spectrometry, offering unprecedented depth in molecular analyses. This review explores the latest advancements in ion mobility techniques and their integration with mass spectrometry for multidimensional analysis of complex biomolecules. We discuss how these cutting-edge approaches enhance molecular identification and structural elucidation, providing researchers with powerful tools to unravel intricate biological systems. The synergy between ion mobility and mass spectrometry enables improved separation, increased sensitivity, and more accurate characterization of biomolecules. We highlight key applications in proteomics, metabolomics, and structural biology, demonstrating the transformative potential of next-generation ion mobility experiments in advancing our understanding of molecular complexity and function.
